section.title: Superlatives
section.sectiontitle: Use superlatives to compare one thing to two or more other things. With short adjectives use the + -est.
section.text2a: She's the kindest person I know.
section.sectiontitle2: With long adjectives use the most + adjective.
section.text3a: This is the most interesting text in the book.
section.text4a: It's the most expensive car that I've driven.

section.title: Superlatives
section.sectiontitle: With two syllable adjectives ending in -y remove the -y and add -iest.
section.text1a: He's the happiest boy in the school.
section.text2a: She's the funniest girl in the class.
section.sectiontitle2: Some adjectives are irregular: bad - the worst, good - the best, far - the furthest.
section.text3a: This is the best CD in my collection.
section.text4a: This is the worst song on the CD.
